required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Digital vs Analog Impression in Cases of All-on-4 - Prosthesis
clinical_study.official_title: In a Post -Covid-19 World, What is the Clinical Influence of Digital vs Analog Impression in Cases of All-on-4 - Prosthesis ?

lead_sponsor.agency: October University for Modern Sciences and Arts

clinical_study.source: October University for Modern Sciences and Arts

brief_summary.textblock:
Fifty six patients were randomly enrolled in the study. Participants were randomly stratified into two control groups and two test groups, from which conventional pick up and digital impressions were made respectively. Patients of group 1 (CIG Axial) and 3 (DIG Axial) received 4 axial implants whereas, group 2 patients (CIG Tilted), and group 4 (DIG Tilted) received two anterior axial implants and two distal tilted implants.
All participants received hybrid dentures. Bone loss, implant loss, maintenance of prosthesis were evaluated at 6m,12m, and 24 months follow up period.

secondary_outcome.description: the loss of implants was evaluated through the follow up period

other_outcome.description: screw loosening, screw fracture, framework fracture, fracture of teeth, remake of the prosthesis , and fracture of acrlyic resin were evaluated

arm_group.description: received 4 axial implants and conventional impression
received 4 axial implants and digital impression
received two anterior axial implants and two distal tilted implants, and conventional impression
received two anterior axial implants and two distal tilted implants, and digital impression

intervention.description: patients received 4 axial implants and digital impression
received two anterior axial implants and two distal tilted implants, and digital impression
patients received 4 axial implants and conventional impression
received two anterior axial implants and two distal tilted implants, and conventional impression

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1) completely edentulous patients with age range from 50-65 years. 2) physically and psychologically eligible participants for implants placement. 3) adequate bone to receive 4 interforaminal implants.
Exclusion Criteria:
- participants were excluded if they were medically compromised, heavy smokers (more than 10 cigarettes per day) and suffering from any parafunctional habits.
